intro: Peucedanum atacorense, commonly known as the Atacora cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
